DOC.brief_summary: The current study examined the feasibility of High-Definition tDCS (HD-tDCS) in reducing epileptiform activity in a 30-month-old child suffering from early onset epileptic encephalopathy. HD-tDCS was administered over 10 intervention days spanning two weeks including pre- and post-intervention video-electroencephalography (EEG) monitoring.
DOC.brief_title: Examining the Efficacy of tDCS in the Attenuation of Epileptic Paroxysmal Discharges and Clinical Seizures
DOC.criteria: 1. Initial diagnosis of Ohtahara syndrome/West syndrome/ LennoxGastaut syndrome by a pediatric neurologist using videoEEG 2. Ongoing synchronous Hypsarrhythmia 3. Modified Hypsarrhythmia with a consistent focus of paroxysmal discharges 4. Signed informed consent of parents/immediate legal guardian 5. Age 10 to 36 months 6. Infant should be in a steady state indicated by a baseline test of electrolytes and biochemistry blood test, heart rate, temperature, respiratory rate, and saturation. 1. Metal in the cranium, skull defects, or skin lesions on scalp (cuts, abrasions, rash) at proposed electrode sites. 2. History of adverse reaction to neurostimulation 3. Significant ECG abnormality
